Comments_List: A knowledge of broadband theory about the sociological process of modernity and postmodernity.

I gained an overview of Sociological key historical figures like Weber and Marx, important written works like the Communist Manifesto and the Protestant Ethic, and interesting topics like rural v urban, race, and role of the church.

So it's not apparent at first, but halfway through this course I literally felt my brain making new connections to things. This is more about building a framework by which to interpret the world than substance. It was incredibly helpful to observe and discuss (post)modernity through theoretical and sociological texts, very interesting course!
Learned lots about sociological theory and the concepts behind modernity and post modernity

I learned an immense amount about how people interact with one another, how we define modernity, and how society is structured. The class made me a better thinker, familiarized me with other perspectives about the world, and made me more aware of the roots of many modern realities.

Strengths: engagement of material and fostering of a welcoming classroom environment
Weaknesses: maybe a few more varied activities within class, not just discussion

Strengths: I enjoyed the final project and weekly blog posts! The blog posts kept everyone reading the readings and engaging with other posts.

Weaknesses: None!
